="preserve">goddess bhumi is the goddess of earth in Hinduism. Depicted as a beautiful woman, seated on a lotus, she is accompanied by an owl as her vahana or vehicle. She plays major role in the hindu epics ramayana and mahabharata. In ramayana, she is the mother of goddess sita, wife of lord Rama. After sita is sent to the forest, she gives birth to the twins lava and kusha. Later at the end, when she is asked to return to Ayodhya, she seeks refuge in her mother, the goddess bhumi. In mahabharata, she incarnates herself as lord Krishna's wife satyabhama. She kills the asura (demon) Narakasura.
In some south Indian traditions, she is depicted as a wife of lord vishnu, bhu devi. She is considered as an expansion of Devi Lakshmi. Bhumi is known for her patience and virtue.
